question: Happy Hanukkah Maccabee. Thanks for the invite Mrs. Kleinman, but right now G dash d's the only one for me. Shabat Shalom!
answer: Give it back! Give me back my yarmulke!

question: Did you just take god's name in vain? Just about to leave, right? You alright?
answer: I guess. Sometimes I wonder why I even bother praying to one god.

question: Hey, hey! Be proud of who you are. You're a bad, bold, big-nosed, biblical brother. You feelin' me?
answer: Yeah. You're right.

question: Aveenooh Shalom Alechem little brother.
answer: Thanks Hammer.

question: Stay Jewish. Happy Hanukkah Tikva.
answer: Happy Hanukkah Morty.

question: So, what's shakin' Yenta.
answer: Well, for stahters, your mother called. She said to remind you that you're having Shabat Dinner by her tomorrow, and also to remind you to bring the Manischewitz, and she wanted me to relate the following information to you.

question: Okay, what's the information?
answer: She said to remind you that you're having Shabat dinner by her tomorrow and also to remind you to bring the Manischewitz.

question: Anything else?
answer: Yeah, I'm going to be out of the office from 1:30 to 3:00 on Sunday. I have a terrible yeast infection and I need to see my gynecologist.

question: But we're not open on Sundays.
answer: I understand that. I just thought that you might want to know.

question: Gentleman! Gentleman! Please! Sheket B'vakasha! Sheket B'vakasha! The time for action is now. We predict that the St. Nick Day Massacre will put Hanukkah-Christmas relations back at least a hundred years. With this meshuggena new Santa Claus in power, Hanukkah is in jeopardy. Our first order of business is to put into motion a plan to create goodwill towards the Jewish Community. Mr. Chairman of the Worldwide Jewish Media Conspiracy. We need your people to crank out a couple more award winning documentaries on the Holocaust, possibly a new Adam Sandler movie.
answer: Not another Adam Sandler movie! We're trying to create goodwill here. I just think... Don't defame me. I'm against that.

question: Focus people. Our next order of business is to assign an agent to track Santa's activities. Step in and use force if the situation calls for it. We need to put the toughest Jew we have on the case. Suggestions? Suggestions, anybody? C'mon, he made ET. We need someone tough people. He's in a wheelchair for crying out loud. Too old.
answer: Joe Lieberman?

question: Perhaps I can persuade him.
answer: It was the day before Hanukkah when she strolled into my office. Come in.

question: Mr. Jefferson Carver?
answer: Please, call me Mordechai. From the way she carried herself I could tell she'd been around the block a few times...

question: Sorry I'm late. Traffic was a pisher, and I've been circling the block for the past half hour looking for parking. What are you listening to?
answer: Oh, the things I would do to her if I had the... Client notes. Sorry. What can I do for you?

question: My name is Esther. Chief Bloomenbergensteinenthal from the Jewish Defense League desperately needs to speak with you.
answer: How is old Chief Bloomenbergensteinenthal? Is he still shtooping every girl he can get his hands on?

question: Actually, his days of marital infidelity have long since past. Now he just shtoops my mother exclusively.
answer: Your mother? Oh. Whoops.

question: Mordechai, Santa Claus has been rubbed out by his son Damian. The man's a demon. There's no telling what this new anti semitic psycho Santa is capable of.
answer: I'm sorry to hear about Santa. He was a good friend, but my days... Sorry Shiksa, I think you got the wrong office. I'm the Hebrew Hammer. Mike Hammer's down the hall. Listen. Esther, you seem like a nice girl, so I'm only gonna say this once. I no longer affiliate myself with that organization. The politics there were brutal. Besides, I've already got a full case load. That's...uh...that's all done electronically now.

question: Why are you being so difficult? All my father wants is to just speak with...
answer: I hate to cut you short, but in an hour the sun goes down, and then it's officially the Sabbath. I can't work on the Sabbath. This is where we're going to have to part ways boobola.

question: I'm not leaving your side until I get you to agree to come speak with my father.
answer: Be my guest. But I have to warn you, I'm going to my mother's for dinner tonight. And if you think I'm difficult, wait till you meet her.

question: You like my Mordechai, yes?
answer: He's...he's very nice. But Mrs. Carver, the fate of Hanukkah rests solely in his hands. Please, you have to help me.

question: Hanukkah, Shmanukkah. It isn't even one of the high holidays. What concerns me more is that my boychick is almost thirty, and has yet to settle down with a nice Jewish girl. I'll make you a deal. I'll help you with your little Hanukkah problem if you help me with my Mordechai.
answer: What do you want me to do?

question: Mordechai. Do you love your mother?
answer: Mom, stop with this already. Of course I love you. You're my mother.

question: Then how come you won't stop this Certified Circumcised Dick nonsense and get yourself a real job.
answer: Mom, I have a real job. I do good things for this community. I help people.

question: When I play bridge with all the girls, everyone has what to talk about with their sons. They show pictures. Their sons are lawyers and doctors and Rabbis. Why can't I show a picture?
answer: So don't show a picture.

question: You know my friend Maureen? Her son, the investment banker? He paid for her entire retirement in Boca Raton. What a mench he is. Instead of schleping to save Hanukkah, god forbid you should go back to business school and get an MBA. Maybe then you could send me to Boca, too.
answer: Oh. Oh, What. So, all of a sudden my saving Hanukkah's not good enough for you? Is that what your saying?

question: I don't want to argue with you. Let's just eat in peace.
answer: No. No. We're gonna argue. And you know what mom? I'm going to save Hanukkah just to spite you. And when my face is all over the television. When your friends are opening their Hanukkah gifts next year, don't mention it to them, okay? I wouldn't want you to have to show my picture.

question: Do what you must. Such a good boy he is. Mazel Tov! What's that Mazel Tov? Your diaper needs changing? Let's let your tuchus breathe.
answer: Mom, why don't you put that cat out of its misery?

question: Jew Confirmation Test initiated.
answer: You've gotta be kidding me. They're still doing this?

question: Please state your full Hebrew name.
answer: Mordechai Baruch Netanyahoo.

question: Please state the six dishes found on the Passover Seder plate in alphabetical order?
answer: Beitzah, Charoset, Chazeret, Karpas, Maror, and Zeroa.

question: Please demonstrate musical aptitude. Please step forward and remove your undergarments.
answer: Oooh. That's cold.

question: Circumcision confirmed. Final test initiated.
answer: Hello? Can anybody hear me? I think this machine is broken or something. Hello? This is ridiculous! I didn't even want to come here. I shlep all the way out to the middle of nowhere, for lord knows what purpose, and... I am so unhappy with this situation. Why Mordechai? Why do you always feel it necessary to do what other people want you to do? Why can't you be your own man...

question: Hello? Can anybody hear me? I think this machine is broken or something. Hello? This is ridiculous! I didn't even want to come here. I shlep all the way out to the middle of nowhere, for lord knows what purpose, and... I am so unhappy with this situation. Why Mordechai? Why do you always feel it necessary to do what other people want you to do? Why can't you be your own man...
answer: Come on. Come on. He's still got it. Welcome back Hammer. Since you've been gone Hammer, some things have changed around here. Our agents are now subjected to a strict physical training regiment. Take a look.

question: A minion practicing Jew-do, the deadly fighting art. Cool.
answer: There's more. Follow me. We've even relaxed our centuries old admissions criteria. Mordechai Jefferson Carver, I'd like for you to meet the Jewish Defense League's first black Jewish agent. A close personal friend of mine, agent Sammy Davis Jr. Jr.

question: Alright. I'll, uh, keep doing that.
answer: Sammy, if you'll excuse us, Mordechai and I have business to attend to. Alright Mordechai, now that we're alone I just want to say that I'm not happy about this. I don't want a repeat of that incident in the West Bank.

question: I got the job done didn't I? I did what I had to do.
answer: A settlement completely demolished, ten smashed army jeeps, four dead Arabs. G dash D damn it, Hammer! You think you're above the Ten Commandments? Just find Santa Claus and bring him back to us. No heroics, got it?

question: Hey, it's your Bar Mitzvah. I'm just readin' the Torah portion.
answer: Well it's good to see that you can be so nonchalant about the whole thing.

question: I guess I could be chalant about it, but then again I'm not even sure if that's a word. Listen Chief, we could stand around arguing all day, but I gotta case to crack.
answer: What's your first move?

question: I'm gonna pay a visit to the K.L.F. See if they've got the 411 on Santa's location. I'll check in with you when I know more.
answer: You be careful Hammer. The fate of Hanukkah rests squarely on your shoulders.

question: Okay. You guys have seriously got to stop with that stuff. That's a lot of pressure to put on one Jew. I'm only human you know. I'm already shvitzing about the whole thing. You know, believe it or not, I'm allowed to make mistakes, too. I can only do the best that I can do, and that's just gonna have to be good enough for all of you. Just...just stop with that. Okay? Alright, I'm out of here.
answer: The Hebrew Hammer! My main Kike!

question: Mohammed Ali Paula Abdul Rahim. My main nigga!
answer: Well it's okay when we call each other that. So Morde-chai, tell me, what brings your bad self down to the KLF?

question: I'm back on the job for the JDL. You hear about that crazy white boy who took over as Santa?
answer: Oh, most definitely. Got the brothers here in full alert mode. Gotta always be cool under pressure. You know what I'm sayin.

question: True dat. True dat. So, what's the word on the street?
answer: Word is that papa's got a brand new bag, and it's velvety red, and it ain't gonna be overnight Fed-Exed to Jerusalem. If you know what I mean.

question: Actually, I...I don't. What does that mean?
answer: Oh. It means that Santa's gonna fuck Hanukkah's shit up.

question: Not if I can help it. You got any information for me?
answer: I don't. But I know somebody who does. Jamal, I'd like for you to meet the Hebrew Hammer.

question: A'ight, a'ight, cool. Yo, it's like this. That nigga Santy Claus be trippin'. First that motherfucker kills his own pops, then he start talkin' 'bout bustin a cap in Hanukkah's ass. Next, the racist motherfucker kick my ass out the workshop, sayin' that there ain't no room for no little colored elves like me. Can you believe that shit? Yo, if it wasn't for the arthritis in my joints, you best believe that I'd be... ...blam! blam! blam! Bustin' caps all up in his ass. You know what I'm sayin'?
answer: Is there anything else you can tell me? His hangouts, his next move, anything?

question: Well, come to think of it, there is one thing. Before I left, I was packin' up my shit and I overheard the nigga talkin' to some business pahtnah or something. Sayin that he'd meet him today at some joint called Duke's. Round five o'clock if my memory serves. When he got off the phone and jetted, I scoped the room for some jewelry, cash, whatevers. You know, a severance package. Didn't find any duckets, but I did snatch this.
answer: Thanks little brother, you've been a big help.

question: He's new. He's still got a long way to go before he understands the true meaning of Kwanzaa.
answer: Thanks again Mo, you always deliver the goods.

question: You watch your back Hammer. Hanukkah might just be his first move. For all we know Kwanzaa could be next. There's a lot of brothers counting on you. If you fail...
answer: Okay, look. I'm going to work really, really hard on this one. But, please stop with the pressure. I'm already tense as it is.

question: It's cool. It's cool. Aveenooh Shalom Alechem, brother.
answer: Alekem Salam.

question: Yeah. This is a sweatshop. And since you elves aren't willing to do the work, I made arrangements to have some Taiwanese children shipped over. And I might add, they're more than willing to work for peanuts. Come on in boys!
answer: So, what's our first plan of attack Santa?

question: While I was in Taiwan negotiating the solution to our labor problems, I came across a factory that illegally manufactures the most addictive, Jewish pride weakening substance on the planet. I bought the entire plant. I want you and your men to target every young person in the Jewish neighborhoods of every major city of this country. I want you to flood their streets with this product.
answer: What should I charge?

question: Oh, that's the beauty of it. These are free samples.
answer: So what's in the boxes? Heroin? Cocaine?

question: Worse. Bootleg copies of the Frank Capra classic, 'It's A Wonderful Life.'
answer: That's some cold shit.

question: Manischewitz. Straight up. Actually, can I have the black label? I figure if this is my last drink, you might as well leave the bottle. Do you guys take Shekels? I just got back from a trip in Israel, and all I've got is a fistful of Shekels. 5733. That was a good year for me. Shabat Shalom, motherfuckers. Shlomo, you okay?
answer: Mommy says that every time you hear the sound of a bell ringing, an angel gets his wings!

question: Huh.
answer: Mommy says that every time you hear the sound of a bell ringing, an angel gets his wings!

question: Bootleg 'It's A Wonderful Life' from Taiwan. Sixty five percent pure. Damn! People could get hurt watching this shit. Come with me.
answer: Chaim Potok's The Chosen?

question: Get yourself home and watch this as soon as possible.
answer: Mommy says that every time you hear the sound of a bell ringing, an angel gets his wings!

question: Hey, hey, hey! You can beat this. Now get going. Chief, it's me. Listen carefully. I need for the Worldwide Jewish Media Conspiracy to mass produce video copies of every Hollywood movie ever made featuring a positive Jewish protagonist as its lead.
answer: You mean you want us to make copies of Yentl, Fiddler On The Roof, and Chaim Potok's The Chosen?

question: That'll work. Get them out to the Jewish community stat. We got an epidemic on our hands.
answer: We're on it Hammer. How'd you do with Santa?

question: It was a trap. I'm back at square one.
answer: Well, then I've got good news for you. We just got word that he'll be making an appearance at the Mall Of America today. I'm sending Esther to meet you there at once.

question: Good thinking. We'll disguise ourselves as a Gentile couple to pass undetected. Now that he thinks I'm dead, this should be a piece of homentashen.
answer: One last thing Hammer. You take care of yourself. The...

question: You're good!
answer: And what do the Jewish people do during Hanukkah? That's right. Santa can tell that you've been a very good boy this year. Run along now Jimmy. Sorry folks, I don't do couples.

question: If you keep your mouth shut and come with me, you won't get hurt.
answer: Excuse me? Do I know you, friend? Take a look around you. Do you even know who I am?

question: Let me guess, you're the goy who stole Hanukkah.
answer: The Hebrew Hammer! You're alive.

question: What's your shpiel, Santa?
answer: Whoa, whoa there. C'mon Mordechai, is this any way to treat an old family friend? Let's cut out all the unpleasantness. I admit, I went way overboard with the whole Hanukkah thing. Let me make it up to you. How about a peace offering? Girls. Bambi. Tawni. I'd like for you to meet world renown Semitic super stud, Mordechai Jefferson Carver.

question: Let's do this clean. I don't want to make a scene Santa.
answer: Well, it's a bit too late for that now, isn't it? Excuse me children, if I could have your attention for a moment.

question: What are you doing?
answer: I'm just calming the kiddies. There's no need to worry about Santa. He's just having a peaceful, adult conversation with his nice Jewish friend, The Hebrew Hammer.

question: Hey everybody. How's it hangin'?
answer: In fact, he's just informed me that he personally plans on cancelling Christmas this year. Why don't we show him how that makes us feel.

question: What is that?
answer: Psst. Hammer, Esther. This way. Hurry!

question: You saved our lives. Thank you. How can I ever repay you...?
answer: ...My name is Harriet Tubbelman, but you can call me Moses. The only payment I ask Mordechai, is that you keep Hanukkah safe for us all. You should be safe from here on out. Just follow the river to it's conclusion. Oh yeah, and keep your arms and legs inside the water craft at all times.

question: Where are we? What is this place?
answer: Welcome to the Underground Jewish Railroad. Just sit back, relax, and enjoy the ride.

question: That got annoying fairly quickly.
answer: Yeah, no kidding.

question: Nah, we're kosher. Thanks though.
answer: So, now what?

question: Now we wait for Santa to make his next move. Want to get a drink?
answer: Sure. Why not. So, do you come here often!?

question: What was that!?
answer: I said, do you come here often!?

question: Oh. Yeah, about once a week!
answer: What!?

question: I said, yeah, about once a week!
answer: Oh!

question: I'm okay right now. Thanks though. Nah, I'm good. I'm kind of here with somebody. Yeah. Maybe next time Joshua. Take it easy. Do we know each other? Mordechai. My friends call me Morty. Uhhh. You know, I...have to go to the bathroom. I'll be right back. Hey there.
answer: Hey.

question: Do you want to get out of here?
answer: I would love to get out of here. Ouch!

question: Sorry. I'm better with men.
answer: Maybe we should try a different kind of dancing.

question: You mean like disco dancing or doing the funky chicke...Oh. I get it. Now we're talking Boobola.
answer: Mordechai?

question: Yes Esther.
answer: I want you to talk dirty to me.

question: Oh. Okay. I want to have lots of children by you. Get a good paying, stable job. Settle down in Long Island somewhere. Someplace nice. Fancy. But not fancy schmancy. I want for our children to go to private schools and take music lessons. Little Abraham will go to Stanford for college, Batya will go Ivy League, maybe Vassar.
answer: Keep going.

question: Afterwards they'll make the decision as to whether or not they'd like to continue their religious studies in Israel. Because, hey, after all we'll have practiced the highly effective assertive democratic style of child rearing, sprinkled with a healthy dose of liberalism.
answer: Oh god, yes! Keep going! Don't stop!

question: Also, on a daily basis, I want you to tell me what to do, where to do it, and how I should live my life.
answer: Kiss me you Semitic stud! Hmm. I feel something poking around down there. Maybe I should investigate. What do you think about that Mr. Certified Circumcised Dick? Shabat Shalom! Wow, that was amazing. What did you just snort?

question: Antihistamine. It's for my allergies. The capsules make me gassy. You know, I've been thinking about what Santa's got planned for us next. Maybe he'll...
answer: Your mother was right. You do work too hard.

question: Oh, she said that, did she? What else did Mommy Dearest have to say?
answer: Well, she also said that you need to find a nice girl to help take your mind off of your work. I'm just glad she thought I was good enough for you.

question: When did you guys have this conversation? When I was in the bathroom? What else did she have to say?
answer: Relax Morty, I think your mom is wonderful. She cares so much about you. Get this, while you were gone she said she'd help me get you to work with the JDL if I'd come eat by you once in awhile. Like I needed any incentive to be with you. She's so...

question: What? You made a deal with my mother to sleep with me if I'd help you?!
answer: No. Of course...

question: What does that make you? What does that make me? And my mother. What does that make her? Oh my god. She's become my pimp. And she's whoring her bitch-son out to the highest bidder.
answer: No. It's not like that. You're being completely neurotic. I was just playing along...

question: Always meddling in my life. This is so typical of her. But from you? I thought we had something good here.
answer: We do!

question: And now my Hanukkah loving friends, I will reveal to you the true nature of my diabolical scheme. The Jewish Atomic clock, located in the outskirts of Jerusalem. Keeper of time for the Jewish Calendar. Powered by Judeum. An element so rare, it exists only inside the clock itself. Once I extract the Judeum from the clock, the Jewish Calendar will cease to exist, forever eradicating Hanukkah. In less than twenty four hours, which by your Jewish Calendar is approximately... Can I borrow that pen and notepad? Four years and three quarters a lunar cycle? Well, whatever! In less than twenty four Christian hours, Hanukkah will be nothing more than a fond memory. Tiny Tim.
answer: Merry Christmas everybody, and god bless us, everyone.

question: End transmission. So, how was I?
answer: It was good. Very chilling, but you still got all the points across that we talked about.

question: Really? Good, good. I wasn't too over the top?
answer: No, it was the perfect level.

question: You okay?
answer: No. I'm airsick you asshole! Where the hell did these reindeer learn to fly?

question: I don't know. Why don't you ask them sir.
answer: Who's the leader of this operation? What's your major malfunction, dumbfuck!? Step forward son!

question: Uh, he can't sir. The harnesses.
answer: You gonna learn to guide this sled right? You gonna make sure your men follow suit? Because if I'm puking down chimneys come Christmas Eve, I'm gonna have your hide. We clear? You eyeballin' me son!? I didn't think so. The Jewish Atomic Clock. Get moving! We've got work to do!

question: Mordechai! Behind you!
answer: What are you doing here?

question: Mordechai, I love you. I couldn't let you do this alone.
answer: I love you too. I'm sorry about freaking out yesterday. I was wrong.

question: I forgive you.
answer: Go check on the clock. I'll finish up here.

question: What's going on? Why'd he stop?
answer: Maybe he ran out of ammo.

question: Take a look.
answer: Well, he's kinda just resting in the corner with his girlfriend.

question: Resting? What day is it?
answer: It's Friday.

question: What time is it?
answer: I don't know. About sundown I guess.

question: Why didn't I think of this? It's the Sabbath. The day of rest. He can't fight on the Sabbath. C'mon, get up. We've got him beat. Well, well, well. It looks as if the Hebrew Hammer's got a weakness after all. Finish extracting the Judeum from the clock. Tiny Tim, I want you to introduce the Hebrew Hammer to the Christmas spirit.
answer: You want me to be nice to him for no apparent reason whatsoever, buy him clothing he'll never wear, and for just one day of the year pretend to forgive him for all the horrible things he did to me as a young boy when my mommy wasn't looking?

question: No dipshit, I want you to kill him.
answer: Oh.

question: Mordechai, you're back. The clock?
answer: Still ticking. Thanks to the help from the Brothers at the KLF, Hanukkah's safe for now.

question: That's wonderful! So why the long face?
answer: It's Esther. Santa's got her.

question: My Esther! Oh Mordechai. Please. Will you help me?
answer: I love her sir. If I don't help you, I won't be able to make her my wife. Mohammed Ali Paula Abdul Rahim has agreed to come with me to the North Pole on a rescue mission.

question: I know sir. I won't let you down. Sammy Davis Jr. Jr.
answer: What's wrong with him?

question: He's still working out some identity issues. It's gonna be tough, but the back entrance looks like our best bet.
answer: I wanted to ask you, how were you able to pinpoint the exact location of Santa's workshop? We've been trying to gain that piece of surveillance for years.

question: This is the year 5734. It's time the boys at the KLF got into the 58th century. Let me show you something. The JDL supplies all its agents with this state of the art device called a laptop computator.
answer: Cool. What's it do?

question: Now this might get a bit technical, but try and stay with me. Using a highly sophisticated connection of other computators, called the Internet, I can access surveillance maps, villian biographical information, and even sports scores with a few simple keystrokes of this electronic typewriter.
answer: Man, that's far out! Hey, the Jets won!

question: But wait, there's more. With a few swift clicks of this hand-computer interface, commonly referred to as a mouse, I can download illicit pornographic material and even send it along to a friend via a cyber postal route known as e-mail.
answer: Porno? You're tellin' me that you can get porno on that thing?

question: Oh yeah. Take a look. For example, here's a picture of your sister Tawanda getting freaky with a German Shepard.
answer: Gettin' freaky with a what? Oy vey, that's almost as bad. That's Tawanda getting freaky with a notorious white supremacist. Where's the white out button on this thing? What just happened?

question: Remember that bit about the cyber postal route?
answer: Yeah.

question: What are you doing?
answer: Just praying to god that we don't kill ourselves going over this wall. You know, you don't have to hold on to my waist. You're tied in.

question: I knew that. Well, that was easy.
answer: Wait! Before we enter, you need to know that my research has determined that Santa's compound is wired with the XP 2000 stereo type alarm system.

question: A stereo type alarm system?
answer: Take a look.

question: How do we bypass it?
answer: The alarm will trigger if the system detects any Non-W.A.S.P. tendencies inside the building. For example, if you were to dribble a basketball, or eat watermelon, or use the word dawg...that is, spelled with an aw as opposed to the letter o...within the confines of this workshop, the alarm would sound.

question: Listen cat, I'll have you know that I hate the taste of watermelon and am a terrible basketball player.
answer: Well that's good news for us. It means the system is outdated. This should be easy. C'mon.

question: It's all clear. Let's go.
answer: Mo, I think you dropped some...

question: Hammer, no!
answer: Let's go! C'mon, let's go!

question: What are you doing?
answer: Offscreen gunfire. That Jewish Atomic Clock stuff ate up a lot of our budget.

question: Where's my girlfriend Santa?
answer: I don't have to tell you anything Hammer! You're gonna have to kill me before I tell you!

question: But if I kill you, then you'll be dead.
answer: Good point.

question: Looks like the tables have turned once again Hammer. And you won't even be able to say goodbye to your Esther. So sad. So long Mordechai. Give my father my regards.
answer: Wait! I didn't want it to come to this, but you leave me no choice. I have no other option but to use the most powerful weapon in the Jewish arsenal.

question: What are you doing?
answer: I shlepped all the way to the North Pole for this? I come to fight you, and you don't even put out anything to nosh on? What kind of arch nemesis are you?

question: Hah! Jewish guilt. Well, it won't work on me Hammer. I'm too strong for it.
answer: What sort of host would treat company this way? Esther is clearly uncomfortable in your guest room. I'm shvitizing from running around shooting people. And my feet. What kind of flooring is this anyway? My arches are killing me.

question: No. Stop it!
answer: And to top it off, you didn't even have the courtesy to give me a proper hello when I entered the room. What have I ever done to you to be treated with such disrespect?

question: Everything's kosher. Watch him for me. Esther!
answer: Mordechai!

question: Joseph Lieberman?
answer: You two know each other?

question: Well then maybe you should have thought about that before you ran with him. C'mon, let's get you back to Washington.
answer: Shabat Shalom everybody!

question: And a Merry Christmas to all of our Gentile friends. Mun Chi. Before we start the Sabbath, I'd personally just like to thank god for all the blessings I've received over the past year. A beautiful fiancee... ...a wonderful mother... ...and the opportunity to help my brothers and sisters in the Jewish community.
answer: Well I'm just glad you're safe Bubba Shaina, and eating by your mother for Shabos.

question: Thanks mom.
answer: But with all the attention the newspapers and television have given you, you'd think that you were the pope or something.

question: Well, I did save Hanukkah mom. My children, and my children's children, and my children's children's children... ...and their children will all be able to eat latkes and spin dreidels, and light the menorah with the knowl...
answer: ...So you saved Hanukkah Mr. Big Shot. I mean, let's be honest Mordechai, it isn't even one of the high holidays. Now, if you had saved Passover or Yom Kipur, then maybe you'd have what to brag about. Did I tell you that my friend Maureen's son, the Investment Banker, was responsible for a very big merger on...

question: ...No, no, no, no, no. I see what you're doing here. So all of a sudden Hanukkah's not good enough for you, is that right? Well I have news for you mom. It is good enough...I'm good enough and I won't leave here until I hear you tell me...
answer: Mazel Tov! Hello Mazel Tov! A boojee boojee boojee boo...

question: ...I'm not finished yet, mom.
answer: ...A boojee boojee boojee boo. What's that Mazel Tov? Your tuchus needs some more airing out?

question: Mom! We're eating!
answer: What a good poop you made in your diaper Mazel Tov! That's right! Mommy loves you! Such a good boy you are!

question: Oh, I get it. To you, the cat pooping in his diaper is somehow better than my saving a Jewish holiday. Forget it.
answer: So, what are you two planning after the wedding?
